DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of informed consent used.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Written informed consent by the legal representative on behalf of the participant/subject who was unable to give assent
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Legally Acceptable Representative As Participant And/Or Study Subject Unable to Do Assent Written Documentation Informed Consent

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Legally Acceptable Representative As Participant And/Or Study Subject Unable to Do Assent Written Documentation Informed Consent
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An individual or juridical or other body authorized under applicable law to consent, on behalf of a prospective subject, to the subject's participation in the clinical trial. (ICH): In the same amount or manner; to the same degree; in the role, function, or capacity of.: Someone who takes part in an activity.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.: Agreement with a statement or proposal to do something.: Printed or written information for future reference.: Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Concepts.definition: An individual or juridical or other body authorized under applicable law to consent, on behalf of a prospective subject, to the subject's participation in the clinical trial. (ICH)
In the same amount or manner; to the same degree; in the role, function, or capacity of.
Someone who takes part in an activity.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.
Agreement with a statement or proposal to do something.
Printed or written information for future reference.
Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

PermissibleValues.value: Written informed consent by the legal representative on behalf of the participant/subject who gave assent
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Legally Acceptable Representative As Participant And/Or Study Subject Assent Written Documentation Informed Consent

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The release from the requirement to obtain informed consent during a study that is granted by Human Subject Protection committee for a research institution for a protocol that is being reviewed by the Institutional Review Board.
